alert.note: Alert for Northern Jasper; Tyler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 8:46PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Tyler and northwestern Jasper Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 845 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Rockland to near Alabama-Coushatta Reservation. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Woodville, Colmesneil, Chester, Ebenezer, Rockland, Browndell, Ivanhoe and Sam Rayburn Dam. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
